meanings.definition: To undo or untangle a knotted or twisted material.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tried to unknit the tangled yarn.
meanings.sent2: I had to unknit the scarf to fix a mistake in the pattern.
meanings.sent3: It was like a puzzle trying to unknit the mess of cords.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was tested as she tried to unknit the stubborn knot.
meanings.sent5: The task to unknit the rope seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: To disentangle or separate the parts of something that is knitted or woven together.
meanings.sent1: He had to unknit the threads to fix the torn fabric.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to unknit the seams to alter the dress.
meanings.sent3: It was like magic watching her unknit the tangled threads effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: She had to unknit the friendship bracelet to add more beads.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully unknit the colors to create a new design.
